Nightshift quickly tries to man a computer to try and get specs on the towe=
r.

" Slag, we gotta find a weak spot, pronto, and go with it!  That tower =
has gotta go!" Scan'n for vulnerabilities now!"

Don't be envious of what y=
ou don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is worth=
 more than family and friends.

On Nov 10, 2011, at 12:38 PM, "Supercyclonu=
s" <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> It was a long trip for the shuttle, =
and a realitvely quiet one. The steady drone of the engines pushing the cra=
ft through the air was pretty much the only sound that could be heard for m=
ost of the trip. 
> 
> Oh there was the occasional sporatic conversation, b=
ut by and large everyone was thinking over what they knew of Cryonosis. 
> =

> As they neared the Antarctic the ride began to get a little more bumpy a=
s the colder winds sent eddies and gusts their direction. However POLAR CLA=
W and PROWL in the front pilot seats seemed to have the whole thing under c=
ontrol. 
> 
> "There she is." POLAR CLAW said, breaking the silence in the =
cabin. A cabin viewscreen came online showing the shuttle passing over the =
many iceflows and coming onto the mainland itself. 
> 
> In the distance, w=
as a stoutly built tower standing up like a spike, surrounded on nearly all=
 sides by white mountains built of ice and stone, surronding the tower like=
 a natually built wall. Inside this 'wall' was a large iced blue lake its w=
ateres also stretching around the tower like a moat. 
> 
> The place looked=
 isolated, cold and remote and yet strangely bueatiful all at the same time=
. 
> 
> "All right we are going in, stay frosty." POLAR CLAW said. "We stil=
l don't know what or who is here, but I am getting strange readings. It's a=
lmost as if . . . "
> 
> Then the tower seemed to turn as weapon mounts beg=
an to unfold. 
> 
> *THOOM* *THOOM* *THOOM*
> 
> "It looks as if someone is=
 already here." PROWL said as the tower opened fire on the shuttle. The shu=
ttle banked and turned and then bucked as it took a hit, and then another. =

> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> 
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Nightshift quickly tries to man a comp=
uter to try and get specs on the tower.</div><div><br></div><div>" Slag, we=
 gotta find a weak spot, pronto, and go with it!  That tower has gotta=
 go!" Scan'n for vulnerabilities now!"<br><br>Don't be envious of what you =
don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothing is wor=
th more than family and friends.</div><div><br>On Nov 10, 2011, at 12:38 PM=

<span style=3D"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"=
ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>It was a long trip for the shuttle, and =
a realitvely quiet one. The steady drone of the engines pushing the craft t=
hrough the air was pretty much the only sound that could be heard for most =
of the trip. <br>
<br>
Oh there was the occasional sporatic conversation, b=
ut by and large everyone was thinking over what they knew of Cryonosis. <br=
>
<br>
As they neared the Antarctic the ride began to get a little more bum=
py as the colder winds sent eddies and gusts their direction. However POLAR=
 CLAW and PROWL in the front pilot seats seemed to have the whole thing und=
er control. <br>
<br>
"There she is." POLAR CLAW said, breaking the silence=
 in the cabin. A cabin viewscreen came online showing the shuttle passing o=
ver the many iceflows and coming onto the mainland itself. <br>
<br>
In the=
 distance, was a stoutly built tower standing up like a spike, surrounded o=
n nearly all sides by white mountains built of ice and stone, surronding th=
e tower like a natually built wall. Inside this 'wall' was a large iced blu=
e lake its wateres also stretching around the tower like a moat. <br>
<br>
=
The place looked isolated, cold and remote and yet strangely bueatiful all =
at the same time. <br>
<br>
"All right we are going in, stay frosty." POLAR=
 CLAW said. "We still don't know what or who is here, but I am getting stra=
nge readings. It's almost as if . . . "<br>
<br>
Then the tower seemed to t=
urn as weapon mounts began to unfold. <br>
<br>
*THOOM*  *THOOM*  *THOOM*<b=
r>
<br>
"It looks as if someone is already here." PROWL said as the tower o=
pened fire on the shuttle. The shuttle banked and turned and then bucked as=
 it took a hit, and then another. <br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
<br>=

</p>
